message_1:
A tomato is considered "ripe" if its firmness rating is between 30-50 Newtons. If a tomato has a firmness reading of 40 Newtons, and the fuzzy set "ripe" has a membership function of:

- μ(ripe)(x) = 0.6 for 30 ≤ x ≤ 40
- μ(ripe)(x) = 0.4 for 40 < x ≤ 50
- μ(ripe)(x) = 0 for x < 30 or x > 50

 What is the degree of membership of the tomato to the fuzzy set "ripe"?
message_2:
Since the tomato has a firmness reading of 40 Newtons, we can use the first membership function:

μ(ripe)(x) = 0.6 for 30 ≤ x ≤ 40

So, the degree of membership of the tomato to the fuzzy set "ripe" is 0.6.
